attributes.action: Call for a public inquiry into spending on over £100m Brexit advertising.
attributes.additional_details:
'There is mounting concern that the government's £100m "Get ready for Brexit" campaign will prove to be a waste of time and money, with the National Audit Office warning that it may have "limited impact".

The NAO report was published amid growing political uncertainty over the timescale by which the UK might leave the European Union.'

'The £109m Brexit campaign has been the fifth biggest advertising budget in 2019' after Proctor & Gamble, Sky, McDonalds & BT'
attributes.background:
The government's "Get Ready for Brexit" campaign has cost the taxpayer at least £100m and focused on leaving without a deal, even when the Benn amendment prohibited such a course of action.

The campaign has not been proven to be effective according to the National Audit Office.

signatures_by_constituency.name: Kingston upon Hull West and Hessle
